title: 裝修舖撐反送中 被物管刁難 一人一信投佢老母訴

replies.msg:
Email:
info@funing.com.hk

Subject:
A letter of complaint



To whom it may concern,

We are writing to complain about your suppression of freedom of speech.

We learnt from Apple Daily and HK01 that, your tenant 洋江工程 has encountered unfair treatment for political reasons. His pull-up banner, with 1989 Tiananmen Square crackdown slogans on it, was removed impolitely by staff.

Meanwhile, there are several other tenants not keeping the place clear without receiving any warning. We thereby have sufficient reason to believe Funing Property Management have practiced censorship. The tenant has been targeted and your decision is formed solely based on political grounds. This is an obvious violation of civil rights - the rights of individuals to receive equal treatment.

Hong Kong residents shall have freedom of speech in accordance with Article 160 of the Basic Law of the Hong Kong Special Administrative. We condemn the repression of freedom of expression.

While the tenant agreed to remove the pull-up banner after lunch, a security guard torn the slogan off without permission. This is utmost disrespect and marked lack of professionalism.

Therefore, we urge you to rectify this situation by an official apology letter to the tenant. You may also want to re-educate your staff members to repair the damaged reputation.

We shall be obliged to a prompt reply as well as immediate improvement.

Yours faithfully,
_____________
